segments.text: I notice the boy reaching for that cookie jar, his eyes full of mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way he stretches, it’s like he believes he can conquer anything, even if that stool looks ready to flip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see his sister, wide-eyed and eager, eagerly anticipating his triumph.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me smile to see siblings working together, even if it’s for something so small.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet there’s a sinking feeling inside of me watching them, knowing how quickly fun can turn to disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman stands there, blissfully unaware, polishing the plate as if everything is right in her world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish she could just glance over and catch a glimpse of what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I imagine if she did, she would probably laugh, but then panic would set in as she rushed to save them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The open window lets in a gentle breeze, adding to the serenity of the garden outside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But inside, it feels like a ticking time bomb just waiting for that inevitable fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to reach out, to tell them to stop and be careful, but my words seem stuck in my throat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why do children find themselves in such precarious situations, always chasing after sweets?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Every second feels like it could change everything, tipping them toward either joy or a tumble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a sweet moment turned risky, and I’m left to bear witness to both excitement and anxiety.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but hope they make it out without a scratch, but I also know life is filled with such close calls.
segments.speaker: PAR
